Interface PermissionsProvider

All Superinterfaces:
Implementation.ExtensionProvidable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultPermissionsProvider
public non-sealed interface PermissionsProvider extends Implementation.ExtensionProvidable
Interface for performing permission checks.
See Also:
  • DefaultPermissionsProvider
  • Permission

    Method
    Description
    boolean
    hasPermission(@NotNull Member member, @NotNull InvocationContext<?> context)
    Checks if a Member has permissions.

    hasPermission(@NotNull User user, @NotNull InvocationContext<?> context)

  • Method Details

    • hasPermission

      boolean hasPermission(@NotNull @NotNull User user, @NotNull @NotNull InvocationContext<?> context)
      Checks if a User has permissions. Compared to hasPermission(Member, InvocationContext) this method will be called if the command gets executed in a non-guild context, where no member object is available.
      Parameters:
      user - the User to perform the check against
      context - the corresponding InvocationContext
      Returns:
      true if the user has the permission to execute the command
      See Also:
      • hasPermission(Member, InvocationContext)

    • hasPermission

      boolean hasPermission(@NotNull @NotNull Member member, @NotNull @NotNull InvocationContext<?> context)
      Checks if a Member has permissions.
      Parameters:
      member - the Member to perform the check against
      context - the corresponding InvocationContext
      Returns:
      true if the user has the permission to execute the command
